Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the frog skin active peptide family (Brevinin subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.15003829] Gram-negative bacterium:Escherichia coli(MIC>100μM);Gram-positive bacterium:Staphylococcus aureus(MIC=13μM);Yeast:Candida albicans(MIC=100μM).[Ref.21295070] Gram-negative bacterium:Escherichia coli(MIC>100μM);Gram-positive bacterium:Staphylococcus aureus(MIC=50μM);Yeast:Candida albicans(MIC=100μM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.15003829] HC50=7μM against human erythrocytes.[Ref.21295070] LC50= 150μM against human erythrocytes.
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: activity against reference strains of Gram-negative (Escherichia coli, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Enterobacter cloacae, Klebsiella pneumoniae) and Gram-positive (Staphlococcus aureus) bacteria but displayed relatively low hemolytic activity.

Literature.Title: A family of brevinin-2 peptides with potent activity against Pseudomonas aeruginosa from the skin of the Hokkaido frog, Rana pirica.
Literature.Author: Conlon JM, Sonnevend A, Patel M, Al-Dhaheri K, Nielsen PF, Kolodziejek J, Nowotny N, Iwamuro S, P

Literature.Title: Host defense peptides in skin secretions of the Oregon spotted frog Rana pretiosa implications for species resistance to chytridiomycosis.
